page.title: 03Glengolly Village
page.content: Glengolly began as a Council Housing Scheme 16 years ago. Several people have bought land and built private houses. Many tenants have also bought their Council houses. Glengolly is surrounded by farm land.It is situated 2 miles south west of Thurso. All children attend Pennyland School,after which they go to Thurso High School. There are 124 villagers. The majority of the male population are employed at Dounreay Atomic Power Station. A few people are self employed. An ice cream van, Fish & Chip van, Mobile Snack Bar Taxi and blacksmith are based at Glengolly, while others who reside at Glengolly have businesses in Thurso. They are a joiner, a Land Drainage Contractor,a plumber,a farmer, drapery and boutique owners.Those without cars use an hourly bus service to and from the nearest shopping centre in Thurso.
